title: Python Web development
subtitle: Creating a Webapp using flask
author: Nathan Chiche
content:
Hi ! Today we will go over quickly starting a Flask application on a Mac. We will go over 4 simple steps soon after you have all the required installations.

Requirements:
- Homebrew â€” A way to help in installations
- Python 3 â€” A Programming language
- Virtualenv â€” A tool to create isolated Python environments. The problem being addressed is dependencies and versions of those dependencies.

Requirement installation:

Homebrew:
$ /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install.sh)"

Python 3:
$ brew install python3

Virtualenv:
$ pip install virtualenv

Building the Web App:
To start building the web app make sure you have completed everything above including activating a new virtual environment for your project file.

Let's go ahead and create a folder in terminal and activate our virtual environment:
$ mkdir flask_hello_world
$ cd flask_hello_world
$ virtualenv flask_hello_world
$ source ~/flask_hello_world/env/bin/activate

1. Install Flask:
> (flask_hello_world) $ pip install flask

2. Create a new package called app and file __init__.py:
> (flask_hello_world) $ mkdir app
> (flask_hello_world) $ touch app/__init__.py

Add the following code to the __init__.py in the app package:

```python
from flask import Flask

app = Flask(__name__)

from app import routes

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app.run(debug=True)
```

3. Create a routes module:
$ (flask_hello_world) $ touch app/routes.py

Add the following view function to the new routes.py file:

```python
from app import app

@app.route('/')
@app.route('/index')
def index():
    return "Hello, World!"
```

4. Create a run.py file:
$ (flask_hello_world) $ touch run.py

Add the following to run.py to define the application instance and import it:

```python
# run.py
from app import app
```

Directory structure should look like this:

```
â”œâ”€â”€ flask_hello_world
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ app
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ routes.py
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ run.py
```

Before running the app, set the FLASK_APP environment variable and enable debugging:

(flask_hello_world) $ export FLASK_APP=run.py
(flask_hello_world) $ export FLASK_DEBUG=1

Run the application:
(flask_hello_world) $ flask run

Stop the server by pressing Ctrl-C

Save your dependencies to a requirements.txt file:
(flask_hello_world) $ pip freeze > requirements.txt

Final project structure:

```
â”œâ”€â”€ flask_hello_world
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ app
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ routes.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ requirements.txt
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ run.py
```
